The French were already near. Prince An- drew, walking beside Bagrati6n, could clearly distinguish their bandoliers, red epaulets, and even their faces. (He distinctly saw an old French officer who, with gaitered legs and turned-out toes, climbed the hill with difficul- ty.) Prince Bagrati6n gave
